column1: Set 'No' to prevent a map from being dragged.
column2: Set 'No' to prevent a map from being dragged.

column1: The initial resolution at which a map will be displayed.
column2: The initial resolution at which a map will be displayed.

column1:
You can set the desired zoom level. For example, the most common values with zoom level of Google Map:
1: World
5: Landmass/continent
10: City
15: Streets
20: Buildings
column2:
You can set the desired zoom level. For example, the most common values with zoom level of Google Map:
1: World
5: Landmass/continent
10: City
15: Streets
20: Buildings

column1:
Roadmap - displays the roadmap view.
Satellite - displays the Google Earth satellite image.
Hybrid - displays the roadmap and satellite views combined.
Terrain - displays a physical map based on the terrain information.
column2:
Roadmap - displays the roadmap view.
Satellite - displays the Google Earth satellite image.
Hybrid - displays the roadmap and satellite views combined.
Terrain - displays a physical map based on the terrain information.

column1: The width of the map block (CSS length).
column2: The width of the map block (CSS length).

column1: You can use the CSS-length values for the block configuration (100px, 77pt, 20em, .5ex or 50%)
column2: You can use the CSS-length values for the block configuration (100px, 77pt, 20em, .5ex or 50%)

column1: The height of the map block (CSS length).
column2: The height of the map block (CSS length).

column1:
The position of the Google Map on the 'Contact Us' page.
You can use the Google Map widget to display the map on any page of your store. More details you can find in the user guide.
column2:
The position of the Google Map on the 'Contact Us' page.
You can use the Google Map widget to display the map on any page of your store. More details you can find in the user guide.

column1: Set 'No' to disable the map block wrapping with the page content
column2: Set 'No' to disable the map block wrapping with the page content

column1: You can fill in the latitude and longitude manually using this manual.
column2: You can fill in the latitude and longitude manually using this manual.

column1: Location on a map and the marker's title.
column2: Location on a map and the marker's title.

column1: Automatically fill in the latitude and longitude values based on the 'Marker Address' and 'Google API Key' fields.
column2: Automatically fill in the latitude and longitude values based on the 'Marker Address' and 'Google API Key' fields.

column1: If you get an error, please check the 'Google API Key' field. The 'Marker Address' field must be filled in completely including a country and a region. Also, you can specify the coordinates manually using the 'Latitude' and 'Longitude' fields.
column2: If you get an error, please check the 'Google API Key' field. The 'Marker Address' field must be filled in completely including a country and a region. Also, you can specify the coordinates manually using the 'Latitude' and 'Longitude' fields.
